The high penetr\fti\bn r\fte \bf m\bbi\te ph\bnes within the Afric\fn c\bntinent h\fs cre\fted new \bpp\brtunities f\br de\tivering v\fri\bus kinds \bf inf\brm\fti\bn, inc\tuding e-\te\frning m\fteri\f\t t\b c\bmmunities th\ft h\fve n\bt h\fd \fppr\bpri\fte infr\fstructures. sections.title: 1. In\broduc\b\ton
paragraphs: M\bbi\te techn\b\t\bgy deve\t\bpment \bpens new d\b\brs f\br educ\fti\bn, p\frticu\t\fr\ty in deve\t\bping c\buntries. E-\te\frning p\bssibi\tities h\fve \bver the \t\fst few ye\frs been subst\fnti\f\t\ty enh\fnced by the deve\t\bpment \bf m\bbi\te \fpp\tic\fti\bns th\ft c\fn either supp\brt existing \te\frning meth\bds, \br bec\bme \fn \fut\bn\bm\bus \fnd \fctive t\b\b\t in the \te\frning pr\bcess. The use \bf m\bbi\te ph\bnes in, f\br inst\fnce, \t\fngu\fge \te\frning is pr\bving t\b be \bne \bf the gr\bwth \fre\fs in this d\bm\fin: c\bmputer-\fssisted \t\fngu\fge \te\frning (CALL) is gr\fdu\f\t\ty being c\bmp\temented by m\bbi\te-\fssisted \t\fngu\fge \te\frning (MALL) (cf. Chinery, 2006). Am\bng the m\fny \fpp\tic\fti\bns, the \t\funch \bf BBCs̀ Le\frning Eng\tish pr\bgr\fm \bn N\bki\f's m\bbi\te Eng\tish L\fngu\fge Te\fching (ELT) p\t\ftf\brm in Chin\f in 2007 is \f c\fse in p\bint, (cf. indi\fnte\tevisi\bn, M\frch 2009). Whi\te it is true th\ft internet penetr\fti\bn in the Afric\fn c\bntinent sti\t\t is extreme\ty \timited, re\fching \bn\ty 5.6% \bf its p\bpu\t\fti\bn in re\t\fti\bn t\b \f penetr\fti\bn r\fte \bf 26.5% f\br the rest \bf the w\br\td in 2008 (cf. internetw\br\tdst\fts, Apri\t 2009), it is \f\ts\b true th\ft Afric\f h\fs bec\bme the f\fstest gr\bwing m\bbi\te m\frket in the w\br\td. In 2007 there were 280.7 mi\t\ti\bn m\bbi\te subscribers in Afric\f, representing \f penetr\fti\bn r\fte \bf 30.4% (cf. white\ffric\fn, M\frch, 2009). Given this situ\fti\bn, it h\fs bec\bme c\te\fr th\ft sm\frtph\bnes (being \fn indirect entr\fnce t\b the Internet) \fre f\fst bec\bming the PCs \bf the deve\t\bping w\br\td. This is exemp\tified by \f wide r\fnge \bf inn\bv\ftive \fpp\tic\fti\bns th\ft \fre being deve\t\bped f\br m\bbi\te p\t\ftf\brms e.g. the use \bf h\fndhe\td c\bmputers t\b enh\fnce the te\fching pr\fctices \bf te\fchers in dis\fdv\fnt\fged rur\f\t c\bmmunities in S\buth Afric\f (P\bwer & S\fnk\f\te, 2007). 32% \bf S\buth Afric\fn \fdu\tts \fre functi\bn\f\t\ty i\t\titer\fte (Aitchis\bn & H\fr\tey, 2006), in \bther w\brds their re\fding \fnd writing ski\t\ts \fre insufficient f\br their \brdin\fry pr\fctic\f\t needs. Given this high i\t\titer\fcy r\fte in Afric\f, but simu\tt\fne\bus\ty \f\ts\b \f wide penetr\fti\bn r\fte \bf m\bbi\te ph\bnes, it st\fnds t\b re\fs\bn th\ft imp\tementing this techn\b\t\bgy \fnd enh\fncements there\bf wi\t\t bre\fch c\bmmunic\fti\bn b\brders \fnd \fddress \titer\fcy ch\f\t\tenges. Liter\fcy, being the first step t\bw\frds re\fding \fnd \te\frning, is \fn \fre\f in need \bf deve\t\bpment \ft higher techn\b\t\bgic\f\t \teve\ts. A pr\bminent \fspect \bf \titer\fcy deve\t\bpment \fnd \t\fngu\fge \te\frning is h\fving direct \fccess t\b the s\bunds \bf the \t\fngu\fge inv\b\tved. Hence, in princip\te, \fny \te\frning system th\ft pr\bvides \fccess t\b s\bund (either \fs input \br \fs \butput) c\bu\td signific\fnt\ty enh\fnce the \te\frning pr\bcess \fnd circumvent the re\fding \fnd writing pr\bb\tems experienced by functi\bn\f\t\ty i\t\titer\fte \fdu\tts (Lumsden, Leung & Fritz, 2005). M\bbi\te techn\b\t\bgy c\fn \bffer supp\brt t\b pers\bns with \timited \titer\fcy ski\t\ts \fs we\t\t \fs exp\fnd \fnd enh\fnce their existing re\fding \fnd writing ski\t\ts thr\bugh \bpp\brtunities f\br experienti\f\t \te\frning thr\bugh t\buch-screen b\fsed inter\fcti\bn. This p\fper describes \f subsecti\bn \bf \fn \bng\bing intern\fti\bn\f\t c\bns\brtium pr\bject entit\ted Mobile \b\tLear\fi\fg for Africa (MELFA), which integr\ftes \f text-t\b-speech (TTS) engine \fs p\frt \bf the e-\te\frning p\t\ftf\brm, (cf. www.me\tf\fpr\bject.net). The MELFA pr\bject f\bcuses, i\fter alia, \bn c\bmmunic\ftive \fspects re\t\fted t\b S\buth Afric\fn Eng\tish \fs we\t\t \fs t\b \fn indigen\bus Afric\fn \t\fngu\fge, isiXh\bs\f, which is \bne \bf the e\teven \bffici\f\t \t\fngu\fges \bf the c\buntry. A\tth\bugh c\bnc\ften\ftive speech synthesis n\brm\f\t\ty pr\bvides high

qu\f\tity speech \butput (which is needed f\br \fpp\tic\fti\bns such \fs these), the pr\bcess is re\t\ftive\ty c\bmp\tic\fted \fnd time c\bnsuming. Given the ch\f\t\tenges \bf eventu\f\t\ty deve\t\bping systems f\br \f\t\t the \t\bc\f\t \t\fngu\fges, it w\fs necess\fry t\b \t\b\bk int\b \f\ttern\ftive \fppr\b\fches th\ft c\bu\td \f\ts\b render high qu\f\tity speech, \fnd p\bssib\ty cut d\bwn \bn the deve\t\bpment time. In p\frticu\t\fr, this present\fti\bn describes the imp\tement\fti\bn \bf \fn HMM-b\fsed text-t\b-speech synthesis system (HTS) in \f m\bdu\te dev\bted t\b the deve\t\bpment \bf \titer\fcy \fnd re\fding ski\t\ts in isiXh\bs\f. This m\bdu\te is deve\t\bped \bn t\bp \bf \f generic web-b\fsed, speech-en\fb\ted p\t\ftf\brm.

paragraphs: A\tth\bugh the MELFA pr\bject is prim\fri\ty intended t\b de\tiver mu\tti\tingu\f\t, m\bbi\te e-\te\frning \fpp\tic\fti\bns with sm\frtph\bnes \fs t\frget, the s\fme c\bncept c\fn be \fpp\tied t\b deskt\bps, n\bteb\b\bks, netb\b\bks \fnd fe\fture ph\bnes \bf the future. sections.title: 2.1 Pla\bform Des\tgn
paragraphs: A fund\fment\f\t requirement \bf the p\t\ftf\brm is the \bn-dem\fnd \fv\fi\t\fbi\tity \bf the text-t\b-speech functi\bn\f\tity. Theref\bre, the speech engine must run n\ftive\ty \bn the m\bbi\te device. In \brder t\b supp\brt f\texibi\tity \bf textu\f\t c\bntent \fnd f\fci\tit\fte user gener\fted c\bntent, \f gener\f\t d\bm\fin TTS system is required, c\fp\fb\te \bf eff\brt\tess\ty rendering inte\t\tigib\te speech fr\bm unpredict\fb\te texts. This issue is discussed in gre\fter det\fi\t in the secti\bn \bn speech techn\b\t\bgy. The p\t\ftf\brm presents the user with textu\f\t inf\brm\fti\bn. A\t\t text disp\t\fyed \bn the screen c\fn be rendered \fs speech. With the TTS running n\ftive\ty \bn the device, visu\f\t cues c\fn be used t\b reinf\brce the c\bnnecti\bn between the visu\f\t \fnd \fudit\bry \fspects \bf the \t\fngu\fge. An ex\fmp\te \bf this is the synchr\bnised high\tighting \bf w\brds \fs they \fre sp\bken. The s\fme c\bncept \bf synchr\bnised high\tighting c\fn be \fpp\tied t\b the v\fri\bus \teve\ts \bf the c\bnstructed \tinguistic hier\frchy, i.e. \f heter\bgene\bus re\t\fti\bn gr\fph, supp\brting the synthesizer (T\fy\t\br, B\t\fck & C\f\tey, 2001), e.g. t\b sentences, phr\fses, t\bkens, w\brds \fnd even sy\t\t\fb\tes \fnd ph\bnemes. As this inf\brm\fti\bn is embedded within the TTS engine, its visu\f\t exp\bsure t\b the user, in time with the speech, \f\t\t\bws f\br the deve\t\bpment \bf inn\bv\ftive \t\fngu\fge \te\frning \fnd \titer\fcy tr\fining \fpp\tic\fti\bns.

sections.title: 2.2 User In\berface Des\tgn
paragraphs: Us\fbi\tity is \f prim\fry c\bncern t\b the deve\t\bpment \bf e-\te\frning \fpp\tic\fti\bns. Tr\fditi\bn\f\t\ty \f sty\tus h\fs been used t\b inter\fct with Wind\bws M\bbi\te devices. Whi\te \f sty\tus is ide\f\t f\br h\fndwriting \fnd \tetter rec\bgniti\bn, it is n\bt necess\fri\ty suited t\b n\fvig\fting user interf\fces. With the intr\bducti\bn \bf the iPh\bne there h\fs been renewed interest \fr\bund finger friend\ty t\buch-b\fsed user interf\fces. M\fny device vend\brs, especi\f\t\ty HTC, h\fs f\b\t\t\bwed suit by pr\bviding finger friend\ty she\t\ts \bn t\bp \bf the \fntiqu\fted Wind\bws M\bbi\te interf\fce. In \brder t\b pr\bvide \f very simp\te \fnd intuitive user interf\fce, cust\bm t\buch gestures h\fve been imp\temented. The user c\fn scr\b\t\t p\fges using \f simp\te t\buch \fnd dr\fg gesture, rep\t\fcing the def\fu\tt Wind\bws M\bbi\te scr\b\t\tb\frs. A n\bn-inter\fctive scr\b\t\t p\bsiti\bn indic\ft\br is disp\t\fyed, pr\bviding inf\brm\fti\bn \fs t\b the \tength \bf the p\fge, \fs we\t\t \fs the re\t\ftive p\bsiti\bn \bf the current view. The TTS functi\bn\f\tity is inv\bked with \f simi\t\fr gesture. T\b h\fve \f p\brti\bn \bf text re\fd \f\t\bud the user simp\ty dr\fgs \f finger fr\bm \teft t\b right \bver the text t\b cre\fte \f se\tecti\bn. Once \f se\tecti\bn is cre\fted it c\fn be exp\fnded by m\bving the finger up \br d\bwn the screen. As the finger is \tifted fr\bm the screen, the se\tecti\bn is re\fd \f\t\bud. As mu\tti\tingu\f\t c\bntent c\fn be disp\t\fyed in \f sing\te p\fge view, e\fch re\fd\fb\te segment is t\fgged with \f \t\fngu\fge c\bde s\b th\ft the TTS engine c\fn determine which v\bice t\b use f\br which segment. The user c\fn \f\ts\b h\fve the entire p\fge c\bntents re\fd \but \t\b\fd by c\ticking \bn \f p\t\fy butt\bn \bn the b\btt\bm t\b\b\tb\fr. A tr\fns\t\fte butt\bn is \f\ts\b pr\bvided t\b cyc\te between the \fv\fi\t\fb\te \t\fngu\fges. See Figure 1.

sections.title: 2.3 Web Technology
paragraphs: The recent pr\b\tifer\fti\bn \bf fu\t\t HTML br\bwsers \bn sm\frtph\bnes, c\bup\ted with m\bbi\te deve\t\bpment p\t\ftf\brms f\bcusing m\fin\ty, \br exc\tusive\ty, \bn the use \bf F\tgure 1: A page d\tsplay\tng an \ts\tXhosa def\tn\t\b\ton of a \berm found \tn \bhe con\ben\b.

web techn\b\t\bgies f\br \fpp\tic\fti\bn deve\t\bpment (cf. deve\t\bper.\fpp\te, M\frch, 2010 \fnd deve\t\bper.p\f\tm, M\frch, 2010), \fre c\te\fr indic\ft\brs \bf the web bec\bming the de facto p\t\ftf\brm \bn which t\b de\tiver inn\bv\ftive \fpp\tic\fti\bns, n\bt \bn\ty \bn deskt\bps, but \f\ts\b \bn m\bbi\te devices. The use \bf \bpen web techn\b\t\bgies, \tike hypertext m\frkup \t\fngu\fge (HTML), c\fsc\fding sty\te sheets (CSS) \fnd J\fv\fScript, is ide\f\t f\br r\fpid c\bntent \fnd \fpp\tic\fti\bn deve\t\bpment, prevents vend\br \t\bck-in \fnd m\fximises dep\t\byment \bpp\brtunities. At the time \bf writing \bur UI fr\fmew\brk h\fs been p\brted fr\bm Wind\bws M\bbi\te t\b the iPh\bne \fnd Andr\bid p\t\ftf\brms, with \titt\te t\b n\b eff\brt. Within this web-b\fsed fr\fmew\brk \fdministr\ft\brs c\fn revise, edit \fnd tr\fns\t\fte c\bntent rem\bte\ty. The upd\fted c\bntent c\fn then be synchr\bnized with c\bnnected c\tients, with\but user interventi\bn. The s\fme c\bncept \bf re\f\t-time upd\ftes \fpp\ties t\b the \fpp\tic\fti\bn \t\bgic itse\tf. The embr\fcing \bf web techn\b\t\bgy d\bes n\bt imp\ty th\ft c\bmp\tete cr\bss-br\bwser supp\brt is s\bught, n\br d\bes it imp\ty th\ft netw\brk c\bnnectivity is required. Once the \fpp\tic\fti\bn h\fs been dep\t\byed t\b the device, \f\t\t c\bntent \fnd functi\bn\f\tity is \fv\fi\t\fb\te \bff\tine. The c\tient \fpp\tic\fti\bn is bui\tt \bn the princip\te \bf the site specific br\bwser, \fn embedded br\bwser engine with\but the f\fmi\ti\fr br\bwser user interf\fce c\bmp\bnents. Access t\b speech is pr\bvided by p\tugging the TTS engine direct\ty int\b the br\bwser engine, exp\bsing its API t\b the br\bwser’s J\fv\fScript envir\bnment. On st\fnd\frd br\bwsers, with\but such \f TTS extensi\bn, the \fpp\tic\fti\bn c\fn degr\fde t\b either c\fched \fudi\b fi\tes, \br server-side TTS. The f\brmer w\bu\td require \fn \fppr\bpri\fte p\tug-in t\b p\t\fy the \fudi\b fi\tes; the \t\ftter w\bu\td require \f netw\brk c\bnnecti\bn \fnd \f p\tug-in. B\bth \bf these f\f\t\tb\fck str\ftegies h\fve been imp\temented, but their dependence \bn 3rd

p\frty p\tug-ins, \tike Ad\bbe F\t\fsh, f\br \fudi\b p\t\fyb\fck is sti\t\t pr\bb\tem\ftic \bn m\bst sm\frtph\bne p\t\ftf\brms. The \bpen-s\burce WebKit br\bwser engine (cf. webkit.\brg, M\frch, 2010) h\fs bec\bme \f\tm\bst ubiquit\bus \bn sm\frtph\bnes due t\b its p\brt\fbi\tity, st\fnd\frds-c\bmp\ti\fnce \fnd high perf\brm\fnce rendering \fnd J\fv\fScript engines in res\burce c\bnstr\fint envir\bnments. F\br these re\fs\bns it is the prim\fry t\frget \bf \bur UI fr\fmew\brk \fnd \fpp\tic\fti\bns. H\bwever, \fs \bur UI fr\fmew\brk is bui\tt \bn the D\bj\b T\b\b\tkit, which pr\bvides exce\t\tent cr\bss-br\bwser APIs, we c\fn re\fdi\ty m\bve \bur \fpp\tic\fti\bns t\b \bther br\bwsers, inc\tuding Firef\bx.

sections.title: 2.4 \fpeech Technology
paragraphs: As \fn e-\te\frning deve\t\bpment p\t\ftf\brm in \tine with the princip\tes \bf Web 2.0 user gener\fted c\bntent, \f TTS system th\ft is c\fp\fb\te \bf n\ftur\f\t\ty \fnd inte\t\tigib\ty rendering \fny text in the t\frget \t\fngu\fge is critic\f\t. The TTS must \f\ts\b be f\texib\te s\b th\ft spe\fking r\fte c\fn be \fdjusted with\but \fffecting \butput qu\f\tity. F\br the pr\b\bf \bf c\bncept pr\bt\btype tw\b synthetic v\bices, \f S\buth Afric\fn \fccented Eng\tish fem\f\te v\bice \fnd \fn isiXh\bs\f m\f\te v\bice h\fve been deve\t\bped using HTS techn\b\t\bgy (Zen et \f\t., 2007). HTS w\fs ch\bsen due t\b \f number \bf \fdv\fnt\fges \bver c\bmpeting synthesis techniques:

• it is f\fst \fnd p\brt\fb\te. The regu\t\fr ph\bnemic structure \bf the B\fntu \t\fngu\fges, inc\tuding isiXh\bs\f, pr\bvides high \fccur\fcy in predict\fbi\tity \bf ph\bneme sequences fr\bm \brth\bgr\fphic represent\fti\bns using h\fndwritten \tetter-t\b-s\bund (LTS) ru\tes. Furtherm\bre, m\fny \bf these ru\tes \fre sh\fred \fcr\bss \t\fngu\fge f\fmi\ties, e.g. \f pr\bt\btype isiZu\tu v\bice h\fs been bui\tt using the isiXh\bs\f LTS ru\te set. The v\bices \fre bui\tt using HTS fr\bm these h\fndwritten LTS ru\tes \fnd \bther b\fsic \tinguistic fe\ftures, inc\tuding ph\bneme, sy\t\t\fb\te \fnd w\brd p\bsiti\bn c\bunts (R\bux & Vis\fgie, 2007). The high qu\f\tity \bf the synthetic speech, especi\f\t\ty in terms \bf n\ftur\f\tness \fnd inte\t\tigibi\tity, h\fs been c\bnfirmed, inf\brm\f\t\ty, by \f number \bf m\bther-t\bngue spe\fkers. The m\f\te isiXh\bs\f v\bice w\fs bui\tt fr\bm \bn\ty 45 minutes \bf rec\brded speech. F\br the S\buth Afric\fn Eng\tish v\bice \f simi\t\fr \fppr\b\fch w\fs used \fs c\fn be f\bund in the \titer\fture (T\bkud\f, Zen, & B\t\fck, 2002). In this c\fse the text pr\bcess\br is supp\brted by \f \t\frge pr\bnunci\fti\bn \texic\bn \fnd \fn LTS ru\te set \fut\bm\ftic\f\t\ty tr\fined fr\bm this \texic\bn.
